info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 02 at 3:32PM CDT until May 02 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL UNION AND SOUTHERN TIPPAH COUNTIES... At 331 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Keownville, or near New Albany, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... New Albany, Ripley, Blue Mountain, Keownville, Falkner, Dumas, Cotton Plant, Shari, Union Hill, Murry, Martintown, Wallerville, Concord, Pumpkin Center, Molino, Clarysville, Baker, Peoples, Beacon Hill and Smalco. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
